description: Ace Frehley, the original lead guitarist and founding member of the rock band Kiss, has died at 74.
title: Ace Frehley, Kiss's original lead guitarist and founding member, dead at 74

description: The owner of an Ottawa medical manufacturer operating in violation of its nuclear licence says he has no intention of complying with Canada's nuclear regulator, which last year ordered Best Theratronics to restore a $1.8 million financial guarantee
title: Owner of Ottawa medical manufacturer says he has no money to comply with nuclear regulator

description: Former Trump administration national security adviser John Bolton was charged Thursday with illegally storing and transmitting classified information.
title: John Bolton, Trump's ex-national security adviser, charged in classified information probe

description: The head of the Assembly of First Nations says she’s disappointed Indigenous leaders aren’t allowed to fully participate in this week’s first ministers’ meeting on public safety. Instead, Indigenous politicians got just an afternoon to address federal, provincial and territorial ministers before they were excluded, said National Chief Cindy Woodhouse-Nepinak.
title: Indigenous leaders ‘not allowed’ to fully partake in ministers’ meeting on public safety, says national chief

description: Online misinformation, political polarization and algorithms designed to keep users on an app have drastically changed the social media landscape over the years. Experts say both politicians and voters can’t ignore social media in elections, but they shouldn’t rely on it either.
title: Social media reshaped elections, but is it still the tool it once was?

description: As the days shorten and temperatures drop, chlorophyll in leaves breaks down, and they turn to the autumn tones of yellow, orange and red. Check out the scenic fall foliage in Canada, the United States and beyond.
title: IN PHOTOS | Scenic fall foliage here and abroad

description: A 52-year-old Nova Scotia man charged with drug offences linked to spiritual ceremonies he led at his rural home using a hallucinogenic tea from the Amazon will avoid a criminal record in the case so long as he follows a three-year probation order.
title: N.S. man who used psychedelic tea in spiritual ceremonies given conditional discharge

description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Thursday he will meet again with Russian President Vladimir Putin in person, in an effort to end the war in Ukraine. A date has not been set, but Trump wrote on social media that the meeting would take place in Budapest, Hungary. The call came ahead of Trump's meeting on Friday at the White House with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
title: Trump says he'll meet with Putin again after 'great progress' in Thursday phone call

description: The remains of 14-year-old Samuel Bird have been located and a murder charge has been laid in his death, police said Thursday.
title: Man charged with murder as remains of Samuel Bird located outside Edmonton

description: The head of the International Monetary Fund says Canada is in one of the better fiscal positions among G7 nations — even though the Liberal government is set to run a higher deficit this year.
title: IMF head says Canada has fiscal wiggle room as larger deficit looms

description: Goaltender Carter Hart, one of five members of Canada's 2018 world junior team recently acquitted following a sexual assault trial, is joining the Vegas Golden Knights.
title: Goalie Carter Hart joins Golden Knights after acquittal in Hockey Canada sexual assault trial
Carney says legislation to toughen sentences, make bail harder to get coming next week

description: A family who lost three loved ones in a fatal wrong-way crash on Highway 401 last year has launched a lawsuit against the officers involved, the police board and the estate of the suspect also killed in the crash that police were pursuing.
title: Survivors of wrong-way highway crash east of Toronto suing officers involved, police force

description: Almost half the people who follow the Canadian Football League are OK with or support proposed changes to league’s rules — but nearly two-thirds say now is not the time to make the CFL more like the U.S. game, a new national poll suggests.
title: Majority of Canadians who follow CFL say now is not the time to make it more like the NFL, poll suggests

description: Canadian Tire acquired HBC's intellectual property, including the striped blanket design, earlier this year for $30 million as part of the wind down of the retailer.
title: Canadian Tire will start selling iconic Hudson's Bay blankets, donating proceeds to Indigenous fund

description: Dalton Stewart, 23, chose not to speak when he was handed the sentence Thursday in Barrington provincial court.
title: $25K fine will not undo damage of massive N.S. wildfire, says judge as man sentenced

description: Rising trade tensions with the U.S., along with questions about Canada’s sovereignty, initiated a review of the purchase of F-35 fighter jets. For the time being, Canada has contractually committed to buying 16 F-35s, with the option to purchase up to 88.
title: Think F-35 fighter jets are all-American? Canada actually plays a major role in production

description: Surrey police say an Indian celebrity's local café twice targeted by gunmen has been hit with bullets once again, in what has become common violence often associated with extortion.
title: Surrey, B.C., café hit with bullets a 3rd time in suspected extortion-related case: police

description: Hundreds of additional visitors came to the Hessische Landesmuseum in the central German city of Wiesbaden over the weekend to admire a painting that bears a striking resemblance to the opening scene of Taylor Swift's current No. 1 hit music video, The Fate of Ophelia. It depicts the Shak
title: Taylor Swift fans flock to German museum to see painting with similarities to The Fate of Ophelia video

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is announcing new measures to reduce crime and improve community safety.
title: Prime minister announces measures to combat crime

description: Several non-profit groups say some Alberta children are going hungry with thousands losing access to school food programs during a provincewide teachers strike.
title: Thousands of Alberta students lose school meals during teachers strike

description: The B.C. First Nations Justice Council has officially opened the Indigenous Diversion Centre in Prince George, B.C., which gives Indigenous offenders the option to participate in a 90-day therapeutic program to have their charges dropped.
title: B.C. program offers Indigenous offenders alternative to criminal charges

description: Israel said on Thursday it was preparing for the reopening of Gaza's Rafah crossing with Egypt to allow Palestinians in and out, but set no date for its completion as it traded blame with Hamas over violations of the U.S.-mediated ceasefire.
title: Hamas says it needs special equipment to recover more hostages' bodies

description: Drug fatalities have shot up in the small city of Campbell River, which for years has topped the lists of the highest drug deaths per capita in B.C. Frontline workers and users there say they need more services and resources to cope.
title: 'Significant spike' in overdose deaths weighs heavy in Campbell River, B.C.

description: The Vatican's child protection commission criticized senior Catholic leaders in an annual report Thursday for not moving quickly enough to help victims of sexual abuse by clergy and to implement new safeguarding efforts worldwide.
title: Vatican report on abuse criticizes 'performative gestures' for victims, as well as Italy's response

description: A former CTV and CBC reporter hired by Wab Kinew’s NDP government to lead Manitoba’s trade office in Washington, D.C., is earning a $387,000 annual salary, the premier’s office has disclosed.
title: Former CTV, CBC reporter hired to run Manitoba's U.S. trade office earns $387K a year
Canadian home sales slumped in September for 1st time since April
National housing starts up 14% in September from previous month, says CMHC

description: The Matawa Chiefs Council, which represents nine First Nations in northern Ontario, says it has issued a letter to the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission that raises concerns about Rogers's 3G cellular shutdown, which is set for Dec. 31.
title: Matawa Chiefs Council wants Rogers to delay 3G shutdown, telling CRTC it's 'a matter of life and death'

description: Nova Scotia residents can no longer file complaints about their municipal elected officials, a move one advocate calls “dangerously undemocratic.”
title: Nova Scotia removes public’s ability to file complaints about municipal politicians

description: Dubai chocolate bars, TikTok-famous for their creamy green interior and satisfying crunch, have been flying off the shelves all year.
title: Dubai chocolate is everywhere. But what came first — the viral sweet or the pistachio boom?

description: As Canadians turn more toward domestic travel amid tariffs squabbles, people in the Indigenous tourism industry say they've noted an opportunity for growth. Some businesses say they're noticing a rising interest in Indigenous experiences and supporting Indigenous-owned businesses.
title: Indigenous businesses and tourism groups note rising interest amid U.S. tariffs

description: The sun has coughed up three coronal mass ejections which, if Earth-directed, can produce the beautiful northern lights, and it seems that they are heading our way.
title: Keep an eye out for the northern lights on Thursday night

description: As a child, Rena Farajova dreamed of dancing professionally in her home country of Azerbaijan, until a heart condition meant she had to stop. Coming to Canada brought an unexpected and joyful return to the dances of her native country.
title: My heart broke when I had to quit dancing. Finding a way back healed me

description: A Nigerian family in Windsor, Ont., is pleading with the federal government to let them stay in Canada not only for what they say is their personal safety but also so their daughter, a 16-year-old cancer survivor, can continue medical treatment.
title: Nigerian family fights removal order while 16-year-old fears return of cancer

description: Several ads on Amazon for tank tops that use the term "wife beater," a phrase deemed offensive by Canada's advertising watchdog, have been pulled from the retail giant's Canadian website following a CBC News investigation. Amazon told CBC it has no issues with the phrase and said third-party sellers must have acted on their own initiative.
title: Tank top ads on Amazon using 'offensive' phrase pulled from site after CBC investigation

description: All seven ob-gyns working at Royal Inland Hospital in Kamloops, B.C., have announced their resignation due to working conditions, according to a letter sent by the group. Interior Health says recruitment is a challenge, while B.C.'s health minister says new recruits are coming.
title: All ob-gyns at Kamloops, B.C., hospital announce resignations
